title: When are we getting a SOLO que?
body:
Premades at this point are close to tilting me insanely hard. I can deal with losing a game but getting shit from a premade as well as having a 4v5 a random didn't wanna deal with 3 premade idiots trolling it's getting irritating. 

Allowing more than a duo in ranked was the worst idea you've had this season, Riot. (arguably the xin buffs too)

When can we get a que for SOLO players so we don't have to deal with the shit premades dish out?

My last game was a 4v5 because our tristana didn't wanna deal with ap lee sin "support" who dives in 1v2 under enemy tower at level 1 (he also had spelltheif) and blames both me and tristana


This is getting out of hand revert thischange or let people play in solo games. Far too many trolls in this game to allow them to be grouped up in ranked

replies.body: Agreed good sir. I love solo queuing because I get put with 4 complete strangers and it's more of carrying with your own skill rather than relying on who's team has better communication.

I continue to get a group of 3-4 who refuse to communicate and feed excessively. My KDA, farm, and damage dealt is almost always higher and the rest of the team always proves to be too heavy. I'm unable to climb and this is getting beyond frustrating.
I think the biggest issue Riot has to overcome is who will fill premades in DQ if all solo players will migrate to SQ.

So because you have a group you mean more than the solo que player? Because you have friends to play with its okay that the one or two guys left out get to be ignored and likely trolled/flamed the entire game? If youve ever been in that situation, you know EXACTLY why solo que needs to be a thing. Its not fun at all, and of course people will go to solo que to keep themselves away from it. Many many games have something similar to this such as Mercenary Team Deathmatch in Call of Duty and its never a problem. Sure que times will be seconds longer for 99% of people, but it will definately help the community in general as dynamic que is wearing people down, and ive already had 2 of my friends quit because they hate the system.

Man, im soloq player, i hate this dynamic shit just as you.

I don't play Dota 2 so I can't weigh in on how that system works. Voice chat either. What I do know is Riot's business hiring structure every year you have new people at the top with the exception of the "very" top. People straight out of school with no real world "big boy job" experience. I am not making excuses. Quite the opposite. Riot has created this culture that basically does not give them the talent or leadership to come up with logical solutions that meet their for profit structure and provide some sort of balanced and fair player experience. 

You are right since dynamic queues have been introduce queue times have increased. I would assume to cover jungle and more likely support. In the past we all had to figure it out ourselves, but that is no longer the case. 

The unfortunate truth I feel is Riots top leadership are not capable of admitting a mistake. They will try to develop some sort of solution that would support all 2's,3's,4's, and 5's in dynamic queue and still have a solo queue. 

They will end up still pulling people from solo queue to fill in their dynamic queue games which will likely create huge backlash because I doubt those players would have some sort of additional reward for winning or some sort of cushion for losing since they didn't want to be their in the first place. 

Regarding queue times only Riot has the data to be able to tell how long queue times would be if 3's and 2's were matched together and the system tried to determine a balanced game. I do not know how Dota 2 works. I dont know if you pick roles like we now do with league, but if Dota 2 doesn't have specific roles like league does that would be a large hill to overcome with queue times and such with their current system of role select->queue. If they reverted back and removed the role select this would be a completely different story. 

Back to dynamic queues today. Yes queue times have gone up a ton because of the sheer imbalance in role select. I do not have a solution for Riot. I mean yeah when supports were basically mid mages in the bot lane then people didn't mind playing support because they could still annie or brand and melt faces. Plus they had the faster queue time! Some people still do that. Especially in the lower ranks, but meh. 

Anyway. I do not know who sits at the head of the table at Riot who says yes or no to these features, but it is very clear to me that year after year Riot has failed at a lot of things and it is very clear that whatever workflows they have for process, balance, or test review are completely flawed. I read somewhere that the test server is only there for bugs and it is not used as a way to check balance. If that is the true case it explains a lot. 

If Riots way of determining balance is from the 7-8 guys who made that dev post about being testers than it also explains all the backlash Riot gets because their tests do not reflect the 80% of their player base.

Woah woah woah, calm down man. Think rationally about this for a minute.

First, where did he say that groups are more valuable than individual players? Why jump at the guy and put words in his mouth because he...contributed to the discussion? He says what he thinks Riot's biggest upcoming matchmaking issue will be and you presume that he thinks you don't matter. Breathe.

Second, why such extreme negativity towards groups? I've literally never had any experience nearly as bad as what you're describing in the nearly 2 years I've been playing. Groups aren't toxic by nature; people have more fun when playing games with friends. That's kind of the whole idea behind this Dynamic Queue. 
But then again, if you're toxic towards one of the people in the group, it shouldn't be a surprise they'll have each others' backs and reply in kind. Next time you're paired with a group don't communicate negatively and the game will go fine almost every time.

And if groups are super toxic towards you, there's really no difference made from them being in a group versus all solo. Actually, it's better to be flamed by a 4-man than 4 randoms, because as Riot stated when they announced the Dynamic Queue, the reports of the group will be weighted just as heavily as the non-grouped members. So if 4 people report you but you report all of them, then each person in the team will effectively have one report.

That's after the game is over, though. When you're in-game...just mute 'em. Like any other toxic player you get on your team, it's really no different. Sure, a 4-man can ruin a game more effectively than 4 randoms. But let's be honest, if any _1_ person wants to ruin a game for his team, it's not that hard. So, again, not that much of a difference with it coming from a group.

Why, specifically, did your friends quit? Did they quit League as a whole, or just playing ranked, or just ranked until the true solo queue is released?

You don't have to get worked up into a fervor and go to the furthest extremes you can think of and rely on hyperbole to convince people you're right. Ease up on it, Trumpy.

The answer to your question is in low level matchmaking. Which in short, is yes, someone playing with their friend(s) does mean more than a solo queue player. From a business standpoint it is simply more profitable to encourage people to "bring their friends" or "play with their friends" more people = more profit. 

When a high level ranked player duo queues with their low level friend, they are matched against other low levels. So the majority of the time low level games have a level 30 or even two level 30s with thousands of games played, full tier 3 runes and a mastery page vs. a rag tag team of level 13's. This has been the state of low level games for years and you have to ask yourself in what world does this seem fair? You'd think that a low level person duoing with their level 30 friend would be matched against other level 30's, because after all it is their choice to duo. But instead they just keep the highly exploitable matchmaking in place and allow these people to farm IP at the expense of new players who are solo queuing.

 The only explanation for this is that people who are bringing 1 or more people to the game with them are more important than someone playing alone. Having an awful time being on the receiving end of a level 30's ass whooping is the price you pay for not bringing along another potential costumer.

TL;DR - Riot makes gameplay decisions to maximize profit, not fun.

Riot doesn't want the solo player playing their game. They were forced into promising a "solo-only" queue because of the backlash of Dynamic Queue, and to top it off, that same solo-only queue will offer no rewards for using it because they see Dynamic as "the future of League". The worst part is that this special queue is only viewed as necessary because Riot doesn't block 4-man premades from DQ like every other 5-man team game does. These other game devs figured out a long time ago that matching a 4-man with a solo player results in that lone solo player getting abused and reported by the 4-man team more often than not, regardless of the game's outcome. To combat the gang up, those games would only allow duo, trio, or full 5-man teams to queue.

It's a bit paradoxical in design, the one Riot decided on. They create a system that heavily encourages you to queue with friends (but only those of your same skill level -- Riot doesn't like it when you play with people too high or too low compared to you) and yet the system still requires there to be solo players to fill gaps while Riot is telling you that being a solo player isn't welcome or how you're supposed to enjoy the game. A lot of the problems would be alleviated if 4-man premades couldn't be a thing but it's unlikely Riot will admit their mistake and take steps to fix it. At least, unlikely until they find some way to spin it as some kind of positive change for the game that further enforces their "you must be part of a premade team to enjoy League optimally" dogma.
